Articles.Content:
dont scrap it. Just ask for special rules if your going to use it. Also, the structural plating isn't important. It's the frame that's important. The frame breaks, and the armor attached dies too. Here's a tip: don't attack armor or the frame directly to fuel tanks. Their too squishy. My ships have decent weaponry, but their armor isn't that tough. Also yes you can use auto lock with the sas.

More building tips? Use girders as the fram. Have lots of redundant parts, such as probe cores. Don't stress too much about fuel, just use efficient engines, and don't leave important parts, like engines and cockpits exposed. With weaponry, you want it to be accurate, usually guided for that function, and have high acceleration. you want to use parts with high impact tolerance for the actual point of the missile, which is why people use wheels for that. The large ones have 150 ms impact tolerance, which is the highest in the game. Also, if possible make your ship mostly empty so its hard to actually take out anything important. Any more question, just ask.

@MiffedStarfish I know why I lost. I only fired one missile. What was I thinking. Can I redo my turn to rectify my mistake? I forgot you could fire more than once.

Edited April 26, 2017 by ShadowGoat

Well beside aesthetic things, my destroyer and my carrier are pretty empty, for the girders, it's a problem to balance aesthetic and a solid frame, but I will try my best, for the carrier will be impossible, it is full of fuels tank in the non-hangar part.

Thx for tips

Edited April 26, 2017 by dragonaether

@ShadowGoat I've already won! You posted  the persist, your turn is over, sorry. 

@dragonaether I would recommend reading through the rules fully, it prevents lot of little easily avoidable mistakes.  Do you have pictures of your ships? They sound interesting. As you don't want to use structual panels for aesthetic reasons, I would just cover the panels with wing plates, they are slightly larger than panels, so no seams, and they look a lot better than bare metal.
Could you sent pictures? I'd love to see your ships besides the Vostok class.

For now I'm working on a carrier, only the hangar and the main sector with fuel tanks, reactor it's finished (already over 1500 parts still to be balanced and I also have to add something to make it stable and to unwoble it), I have to add a couple off things, like the realoding section for fighters, this will take a lot to design. Then I wanted to design an heavy dreadnought and a very experimental ship with a very secret experimental thing

But for now I only have finished the vostok class destroy and isn't that powerfull, I will add a couple of missiles. As soon as I finish the carrier I will post it.

22 minutes ago, MiffedStarfish said:

 

@dragonaether As you don't want to use structual panels for aesthetic reasons, I would just cover the panels with wing plates, they are slightly larger than panels, so no seams, and they look a lot better than bare metal. 

The problem is that I have also an interior design and it will be a 3 layer armor, and that would make the ship very heavy, I will use this with the dreadnought but with the others is impractical.

 

A question, there is a limit for carrier's fighters?

 

 

Edited April 26, 2017 by dragonaether

There is a tonnage limit of 15 tons max for each fighter, but no limit on the number of fighters. But keep in mind that most battles have a fleet tonnage limit of max 300 tons, and a ship is useless if it's too heavy to use.
No, but don't exploit it to a point where I need to make a rule about it.

For now they are just six, but I think I already passed the 300 tonnages with just my carrier.

Maybe I will do smaller carrier with just 2/3 fighters 

Edited April 26, 2017 by dragonaether

If you want a big ship brawl, I'm your man,

as far as I can tell I have some of the biggest ships here.
In your current battles how many are the ships for each side? And which weaponery normally you use?

But biggest dosent always translate to strongest, evidently. 

I'm sorry, that was mean. Here, have some money rep.

@Spartwo I'm not sure whether the fight between the Hyperion and the death would count on the leaderboard. On one hand, we fully complied with the rules, making it eligible, but on the other hand, it lasted two turns between two ships. What do you think?

Edited April 26, 2017 by MiffedStarfish
I don't think it should count, considering it was one battle uncertified ship and one experimental. Also what happened to the 3 way battle.

By uncertified I meant that I wouldn't normally use it in a battle, not that it shouldn't ever be used in battle.

@dragonaether I would say between 3 and 6 ships for a normal battle. As for weaponary, we all have our own different styles and types of weapons, for example, shadow goat uses lots of moderate damage overwhelming missiles, while I use less missiles, but with a focus on presicion hits and high speeds.
Oh believe me, armor plating can be quite sexy.

22 minutes ago, AlexanderTeaH said:

Oh believe me, armor plating can be quite sexy.

Nice ship, well in some cases it could be acceptable, but in my personal opinion they should reteaxture them a bit, as well as a lot of other parts. I mean the future that I see for the human kind is made of white and black parts, not pure metal. I  just found a problem of my crafts, I use the porkjet parts expansion, it's a problem? It doesn't affect nothing of gameplay I think.

What I should use as point for missiles? Besides wheels (for 2.5 1.25,0.625 missilea)

Edited April 26, 2017 by dragonaether
@dragonaether I agree, I'd like to see a lot more panel parts, much like the diversity present in wing panels.
I would love to see procedural wings, but this is only a dream. There are more chance that they add aliens and other systems.
@dragonaether I definitely would love more systems... Urgh... Get on it Squad!

Yeah I'd love if they added multiplayer too. Maybe not as much as if they added more planets and stars, but definitely a good amount. If they add that, then kracken drives would be a new norm in ships, in place of a hyperdrive.
@AlexanderTeaH I'll have to battle you on Sunday, as I'll be away from computers until then.  Would you mind setting up the persist?

@MiffedStarfish not at all, I'll try getting it up on Saturday.

Edited April 27, 2017 by AlexanderTeaH

A little spoiler of my Carrier, I have still a lot of work to do.

I don't think I will continue it, it's becoming so heavy for my PC that while in the editor it crashes my game.

I will work on a smaller one

Edited April 27, 2017 by dragonaether
You and I have very different ideas of light

It's light because it doesn't have defences and don't have a lot of armour, and in my opinion, 6 fighters are nothing. I started working on a smaller one, with just 2 fighters, it will be easier to control and my PC thanks me. That carrier unfinished counted over 1700 parts and weighted over 900 tons.

As soon as i finish the carrier i will work on an assault dreadnaught, that will be cool. (at least is cool in my head)

Edited April 27, 2017 by dragonaether

This can count as light now?
i also rearranged a bit the Vostok Class, i added two small missiles and changed engines type.
Edited April 27, 2017 by dragonaether
